method: To calculate the enthalpy change of combustion for methane, first sum the bond energies of all bonds broken in the reactants (4x C-H and 2x O=O). Then, sum the bond energies of all bonds formed in the products (2x C=O and 4x O-H). Finally, subtract the sum of bond energies of the products from the sum of the bond energies of the reactants.
checks: The calculation correctly accounts for the number of each type of bond in the balanced equation.
